content:
I am currently pursuing my M.Sc. degree in Computer Science and Engineering at Sabanci University and working as a Teaching Assistant in Computer and Network Security (CS 432/532) course. In my thesis, I implement a data-driven intrusion detection system for 6LoWPAN based IoT systems under the supervision of Prof. Albert Levi.
I have recently worked as a Research Intern at Purdue University under the supervision of Dr. Z. Berkay Celik. The aim of the internship was to develop security solutions for IoT systems. We implemented a secure and robust context-based sensor pairing scheme in the smart home context. Our work has been submitted to USENIX Security ‘22, Summer Deadline.
In Spring 2022, I will join Purdue University, Department of Computer Science for pursuing my PhD.
My research interests include IoT/CPS security and privacy, wireless network security, systems security, the privacy of machine learning applications, and adversarial machine learning.
  Download my resum√©.
